summary: Jane Lind Downey was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCA). She is listed in several payroll and certification reports from 1978 and 1979. These documents detail her position, annual salary, and pay period earnings during her time with the committee. The reports span from May 1978 to February 1979, indicating her period of employment with the SCA.
significance: Jane Lind Downey's significance lies in her employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations, contributing to the committee's work in investigating the JFK assassination. While the specific nature of her role is not detailed in the provided summaries, her presence on payroll and certification reports indicates her involvement in the committee's operations.
